title: print Fun in nested for loops

content.question: for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++){for (int k = 0; k < 4; k++){System.out.println("Fun");}}Which of the following best explains how changing the outer for loop header to for (int j = 0; j <= 3; j++) affects the output of the code segment?

choices.label: The output of the code segment will be unchanged.
The string "Fun" will be printed more times because the outer loop will execute more times.
The string "Fun" will be printed more times because the inner loop will execute more times in each iteration of the outer loop.
The string "Fun" will be printed fewer times because the outer loop will execute fewer times.

content.answer: The string "Fun" will be printed more times because the outer loop will execute more times.

skill.text: 3.A: Determine the result or output based on statement execution order in an algorithm.
